utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Are you kidding me?! Joey. Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh. Oh, did-did-did I wake you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Gunther, can I get another cup of coffee, please? So uh, what do you do when you’re not working here?

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: You don’t need to fill these silences.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler, that’s like your fourth cup of coffee!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I am drinking lots of cups of coffee because I’m exhausted! Because Joey started snoring!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: He’s in a different room! He’s really that loud?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s not something to be proud of, okay? You have to go to a sleep clinic!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, I told ya, I’m not going to any clinic! I don’t have a problem, you’re the one with the problem! You should go to a "Quit being a baby and leave me alone" clinic!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, they do! Quit being a baby and leave me alone! There, you’ve just had your first class!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y’know I used to go out with this guy that was a really light sleeper, and whenever I started to snore, he would just roll me over…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: He would just roll me over and I would stop snoring.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Next time you snore, I’m rolling ya over!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I gotta do what I gotta do, you gotta do what you gotta do, you just do it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Have you guys picked a date yet?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I still cannot believe you’re engaged! Just ‘cause its happening so fast; not ‘cause you’re such a loser.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh. Thanks. Uh, has anyone seen Rach?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ugh, she’s upstairs not doing the dishes! And I tell ya something! I’m not doing them this time! I don’t care if those dishes sit in the sink until they’re all covered with—I’ll do them when I get home!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah—oh! Hey listen umm, Emily found this wedding dress in London…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, but it didn’t fit. Well, luckily there’s a store here that has one left in her size, but I’m the groom, I’m not supposed to see the dress…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’ll pick it up for you!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, she’s got you running errands, y’know, picking up wedding dresses… Wah-pah!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s not whipped! Whipped is wh-tcssh!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, Mon, I was just doing the dishes!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, do uh, do you have a minute?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, I was just about to take a break anyways, so…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So listen uh, I know you and I haven’t really had a chance to talk since uh, Emily and I decided to get married, and uh, I was just wondering how you were.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know if you were getting married I’d feel, kinda….. y’know.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah. Definitely, well it definitely took me by surprise, but I’m okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right, I just wanted to check.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You’re great. And I-I know someday this will happen for you too. You just hang in there.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, no, I didn’t mean, uh…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I mean maybe you didn’t hear about a serious relationship called me and Joshua?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I thought you guys had just been on like four dates, I didn’t realise that had become anything, yet.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, no-no-no, no-no-no, it has become, it has—yeah. Oh no, those were four great dates.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah. Oh, yeah. And I mean, the connection, I mean y’know, emotionally, mentally, physically…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know isn’t it? It’s like I’m right there with Joshua.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You are right there with Emily. And it’s y’know, it’s kinda like…. it’s a tie! Well, I gotta get, I gotta get back to the dishes.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, y’know, y’know what would make me really happy?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: If like the four of us could all y’know, hang out together. Uh, in fact Emily’s coming into town this weekend, why don’t you say we all have dinner? Say, Sunday night?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, all right, it’s a date.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hang in there. You hang in there.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God! Ohh! Look at this one! It’s so beautiful!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, but y’know, about have of these are gonna end up getting divorced.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, yes, umm, I’m here to pick up a dress that you have on hold.

utterance.speaker: The Saleslady
utterance.content: Yes! I have it right here. Would you like to try it on Ms. Waltham?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You’re the most beautiful bride I’ve ever seen.

utterance.speaker: The Saleslady
utterance.content: And could I get my ring back?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right buddy, time to roll over. No-no! No, no-n-n-n-no!! You are going to a clinic! You’re going to a clinic, and a pyjama store!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Does she use the cups? Yes! I believe she does. Does she use the plates? Yes! I believe she does.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh. Thank you. Ohhh, thank you very much. Oh, thank you for coming. Uh, just a second!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Can you just hold on for one minute?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, you have to let me in right now!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: This sucks! I didn’t know I had to stay up all night before I went to this stupid sleep clinic! I’m so tired!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, I hear that you and Joshua are going out to dinner with Ross and Emily, and I think that’s, I think that’s really cool.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, Rach, I think you’re handling that really well.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Handling it? What do you mean, handling it? There’s nothing to handle. Now, maybe I would have a problem with this if it wasn’t for me and Joshua. Y’know, they’re not gonna get married anyway!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Come on! They rushed into this thing so fast it’s ridiculous! I mean, they’re gonna be engaged for like what? A year? And somewhere along the way, one of them is gonna realise what they’ve done and they’re call the whole thing off. I’m telling ya, you’re gonna be dancing at my wedding before you’re dancing at there’s.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I don’t dance at weddings.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because weddings are a great place to meet women, and when I dance, I look like this…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, what are you guys doing four weeks from today?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Great! Because Emily and I are getting married in a month!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah! Yeah, Emily always wanted to get married in this beautiful place that her parents got married, but it’s going to be torn down, so… I mean, I-I know it’s crazy, but everything up ‘til now has been so crazy, and I don’t know, this just feels right. Y’know?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! That’s the day after I stop menstruating! This isn’t mine.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: What’s up? You’re voice sounded all squeaky on the phone.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, nothing, I just wanted to see you. See you and hug you. See you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m more than okay, I am really, really happy! Wanna know why?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: ‘Cause I am really happy about us. I think we are, I think we are so on the right track! Y’know? I mean, I think we are working, I think we are clicking. Y’know?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah-yeah, y’know if-if there was just like one little area where I—that I think we need—we would need to work on; I-I would think it was we’re just not crazy enough!

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: I-I gotta say, I-I-I-I’m not too sure I agree with that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, yeah, right, y’know what? Yeah, you’re right, I mean, we no, we have our fun. Yeah! But if ……I mean, I mean like craaaazy! Y’know? Okay, all right. This is gonna, this is gonna sound y’know, a little umm, hasty, but uh, just go with it. Umm. Ugh. What if we got married?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I know, I know, it’s-it’s so, it’s so totally like, "Whoa! Can we do this?" Y’know, I mean, but I mean it just feels right! Don’t you think? It does! I mean, it just feels right, don’t you think?

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Wow! Uhh, Rachel uhh, you’re a real special lady, but my divorce isn’t final yet and, and, and we’ve been on four days, so I’m thinking "No, but thanks."

utterance.speaker: Sleep Clinic Worker
utterance.content: Um-hmm, and did you stay up all night in preparation for your sleep study. Uh, sir?

utterance.speaker: Sleep Clinic Worker
utterance.content: Alll right, we’ll call you in a few minutes.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, check out that girl! She is really hot!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, she is. Wow! How you doin’?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You’re coming on to the entire room! I’m Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So uh, what are you in for?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What a coincidence, I listen in my sleep.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So why don’t you give me your number?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m not gonna right to you! That’s not real!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look at me! My big concern is what’s real?! Oh my God. We’re really sad, aren’t we?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, at least you didn’t rent yours from a store called, "It’s Not Too Late."

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, throw it straight this time.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I hate my regular clothes now! Y’know? I look down and-and I know that this isn’t gonna be the most special day of my life.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah. I mean it was kinda fun for a while, but didn’t you start feeling silly?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So, is Joey gonna stop snoring?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yep! And! A beautiful woman agreed to go out with me. Joey wanted to ask her out, but uh, she picked me.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well she’s, she’s the kinda girl—Joey was unconscious.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, they gave it to me at the sleep clinic, and it’s gonna help me not to snore.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, are you asleep right now, Joe? ‘Cause I don’t think you have to wear it unless you are!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know I don’t have too! It tastes good.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I did my best to convince him that I’m not some crazy girl who is dying to get married—I’m just going through a hard time.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well uh, his answering machine was very understanding. Ugh. I feel blue.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ohh, sweetie! Hey, I bet you anything that he’s gonna call you again.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe, but I don’t think I even care. I don’t think he’s the one I’m sad about. Y’know, I know that I said that I am totally okay with Ross getting married, but as it turns out, I don’t think I’m handling it all that well.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And I-I am just trying to figure out why.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, yeah, y’know how Ross and I were on again, off again, on again, off again? I guess I just figured that somewhere down the road, we would be on again.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Again. Y’know what? I think we all did.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, I got us some reservations for Sunday night, okay? How about, Ernie’s at 9 o’clock?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, well, you uh, better make it for three.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, see I-I don’t know if we’re gonna be hungry at three.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Three people. Joshua’s not gonna be there.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh, well, I think, I think he broke up with me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’s okay. Sometimes, things don’t work out the way you’d thought they would.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, hey, don’t you have to go pick up Emily?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, y’know what might cheer you up?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y’know, I gotta tell ya, this really does put in a better mood.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, I wish there was a job where I could wear this all the time. Maybe someday, there will be.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh God! He’s gonna come by and borrow some candles for his big date!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No-no, Rachel, don’t get it! He can’t see us!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, yeah! The groom cannot see the bride!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, you guys, just relax. I doooo.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, wait, Joshua! Joshua! Yeah, well, that oughta do it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dude! I am trying to sleep!
